questions.Q: The result of $$1.25+1.5$$ with the correct number of significant figures is:
questions.E: First, align the numbers and do the operations to get the exact result. $$\\$$Second, identify the number of significant figures and the uncertain digit (in blue color) of each number$$\\$$Third, draw a vertical line (in red) that passes through the right side of the leftmost uncertain digit. $$\\$$Fourth, round off the result based on its uncertain digit and the number adjacent to it: If that digit is 4, 3, 2, or 1, simply drop all digits to the right of it. To do that, remember that the number of significant figures of the result is equal to the number with the least number of significant figures.$$\\$$Third, align the numbers and do the substraction.$$\\$$Fourth, identify the number of significant figures and the uncertain digit (in blue color) of each number$$\\$$Fifth, draw a vertical line (in red) that passes through the right side of the leftmost uncertain digit. $$\\$$Sixth, round off the result based on its uncertain digit and the number adjacent to it: If that digit is 4, 3, 2, or 1, simply drop all digits to the right of it. If that digit is 5, 6, 7, 8, or 9 add one to the rounding digit and drop all digits to the right of it.

questions.Q: The result of $$0.6 \times 18.1+4.0$$ with the correct number of significant figures is:
questions.E: First, multiply the numbers and keep all digits of the result. $$\\$$Second, identify the uncertain digit of the result (blue color). To do that, remember that the number of significant figures of the result is equal to the number with the least number of significant figures.$$\\$$Third, align the numbers and do the addition.$$\\$$Fourth, identify the number of significant figures and the uncertain digit (in blue color) of each number$$\\$$Fifth, draw a vertical line (in red) that passes through the right side of the leftmost uncertain digit. $$\\$$Sixth, round off the result based on its uncertain digit and the number adjacent to it: If that digit is 4, 3, 2, or 1, simply drop all digits to the right of it. If that digit is 5, 6, 7, 8, or 9 add one to the rounding digit and drop all digits to the right of it.

questions.E: First, multiply the numbers and keep all digits of the result. $$\\$$Second, identify the uncertain digit of the result (blue color). If that digit is 5, 6, 7, 8, or 9 add one to the rounding digit and drop all digits to the right of it.
